1022351 THE COTTON CLOTH ACT, 1918
ACT NO. 23 OF 1918 1 [ 26th September, 1918.]
An Act to take powers to provide for the cheap supply of cotton cloth to the poorer classes of the community.
WHEREAS it is expedient to take powers for the purpose of encouraging or maintaining the supply, at reasonable rates, to the poorer classes of the community, of cotton cloth manufactured in this country; It is hereby enacted as follows:--
1733588 1Short title and extent. This Act may be called the Cotton Cloth Act. 1918. 2 It extends to the whole of India except 3 the territories which, immediately before the 1st November, 1956, were comprised in Part B States].]
1883783 2 Definitions. In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,--
898701 a" Controller" means a Controller appointed under this Act;
204121 b" cotton cloth" means cotton cloth manufactured in this country; and
1213610 c" standard cloth" means any kind of cotton cloth which a Controller may, from time to time, declare to be standard cloth.
1656831 3Power to appoint Controller. The 4 State Government] may, by notification 5 in the Official Gazette, appoint one or more persons as 6 it] may think fit to be Controllers for the purposes of this Act, and shall specify in any such notification the area in which any Controller so appointed shall exercise his powers. 2 1The Act has been declared to be in force in the Khondmals District by the Khondmals Laws Regulation, 1936 (4 of 1936), s. 3 and Sch,; and in the Angul District by the Angul Laws Regulation, 1936 (5 of 1936), s. 3 and Sch. 2 Added by the A. O. 1950. 3 Subs. by the Adaptation of Laws (No. 3) Order, 1956 for" Part B States". 4 The words" G. G. in C." successively amended by the A. O. 1937 and the A. O. 1950 to read as above. 5 For a notification issued by the G. G. in C. under this section, see Gazette of India, 1918, Pt. I, p. 1558. 6 Subs. by the A. O. 1937 for" he".
188092 4 Powers of the Controller.
1287142 1Whenever it appears to a Controller that such a course is necessary or expedient, for the purpose of encouraging or maintaining the supply of standard cloth, at reasonable rates to the poorer classes of the community, he may (subject to this Act and the rules made thereunder and to the control of the 1 State Government]) make general or special orders regulating or giving directions within the area in which he is empowered, with respect to the manufacture, transport, distribution and sale or purchase of, or other dealings in, cotton cloth.
1055181 2Without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing power, orders may be made by a Controller--
223657 adeclaring and defining the classes of standard cloth;
230475 bprescribing distinctive indications which shall be woven into, impressed or otherwise displayed upon, different classes of standard cloth;
553943 crequiring any person, who ordinarily manufactures cotton cloth, to manufacture, or provide for the manufacture of, standard cloth in such quantity, of such quality and by such date as the Controller may direct; and
1075519 dfixing the prices to be paid to the manufacturer for standard cloth or for any particular class of standard cloth, and providing for the payment thereof on delivery: Provided that in fixing prices the Controller shall have regard to the cost of production and to the allowance of a reasonable profit, without necessarily taking into consideration the market- price, and if the Controller is satisfied that the manufacturer has incurred actual loss arising out of forward contracts entered into before the commencement of this Act, and that such loss is immediately attributable to an order under this Act, he may take such loss into account:
Provided further that the Controller may fix different prices in the case of different localities or, if special reasons exist, in respect of different manufacturers in the same locality.
137230 5Appointment of Advisory Committees. Where a Controller is appointed in exercise of the power conferred by section 3, the 1 State Government] shall appoint a Committee consisting of such number of persons having knowledge of 3 1The words" G. G. in C." successively amended by the A. O. 1937 and the A. O. 1950 to read as above.
the cotton or cotton cloth trade as 1 it] thinks fit to assist the Controller with their advice in the performance of his duties. Before a Controller issues any order declaring and defining the classes of standard cloth of fixing the prices to be paid to the manufacturer, he shall consult the committee, and he may consult the Committee on any other matter connected with his duties:
Provided that, if the opinion, of the majority of members of the Committee who are present at any meeting is adverse to the issue of any order, the Controller shall, if he does not accept the Committee' s advice, refer the matter for the decision of the 2 State Government].
941554 6Manufacture and delivery of standard cloth. Where, by an order made in, the exercise of powers conferred by section 4, the Controller has directed a manufacturer to manufacture, or provide for the manufacture of, standard cloth and has fixed the price therefor, the manufacturer shall deliver the same at such time and place and in such manner as the Controller may specify from time to time, and the Controller shall pay or cause to be paid to the manufacturer the said price, together with the freight, if any, actually paid by the manufacturer.
987086 7Delegation of powers. Subject to the control of the 2 State Government], a Controller may, from time to time by order in writing, delegate all or any of his powers subject to such conditions and restrictions as may be prescribed therein.
1108379 8Penalty for disobedience or orders under section 4. If any person acts in contravention of or, without reasonable cause, fails to comply with the provisions of any order made under section 4, or counterfeits upon any cloth a distinctive indication prescribed by the Controller, such person shall be punishable with imprisonment which may extend to six months, or with fine or with both.
1895460 9 Power to fix prices of standard cloth.
321341 1The State Government shall, if standard cloth is sold in the State, by order in writing which shall be notified in the Official Gazette, fix the price at which alone standard cloth or any class of standard cloth shall be sold to the public.
379474 2Orders may be made fixing different prices for different localities or for different methods of sale. 4 1Subs. by the A. O. 1937 for" he". 2 The words" G. G. in C." successively amended by the A. O. 1937 and the A. O. 1950 to read as above.
884124 3Every such order shall be published in such manner as the State Government may consider to be best adapted for bringing the prices so fixed to the notice of the poorer classes.
1769296 10 Limitation of sale of standard cloth.
1200231 1No person shall sell or keep, offer or expose for sale to the public, standard cloth otherwise than at such price as may be fixed by the State Government and in accordance with the terms and conditions of a licence issued in this behalf.
1743471 2If any person contravenes the provisions of sub- section (1), he shall be punishable with imprisonment which may extend to six months, or with fine or with both.
561984 11Grant of licences for sale of standard cloth. A licence for the sale of standard cloth shall be granted by such authority, in such form and subject to such conditions as the State Government may prescribe by rules made under this Act.
999945 12 Rule- making power.
852806 1The 1 State Government] may make rules--
155238 aprescribing the powers and duties of the Controller,
205241 bprescribing the manner in which the Controller' s orders shall be published or served, as the case may be, and
813605 cgenerally giving effect to the provisions of this Act.
964967 2The State Government shall, if standard cloth is sold in the State, make rules prescribing the authority by which, the form in which and the conditions under which, any licence or class of licences for the sale of standard cloth shall be granted.
171207 3Rules made under this Act shall be published in 2 the Official Gazette, 3 and on such publication shall have effect as if enacted in this Act.
1316083 13Protection for acts done under the Act. No suit, prosecution or other legal proceeding shall lie against any person for anything which is in good faith done or intended to be done under this Act.
1255939 14Powers to Act to be cumulative. All powers given, by this Act shall be in addition to and not in derogation of any other powers conferred by or under any enactment, and all such powers may be exercised in the same manner and by the same authority as if this Act had not been made. 5 1The words" G. G. in C." successively amended by the A. O. 1937 and the A. O. 1950 to read as above. 2 The words" the Gazette of India or" omitted by the A. O. 1937. 3 The words" as the case may be", omitted by the A. O. 1937.
